description: From Middle English stith, from Old Norse steði. Compare stithy.

examples: strike on the stith while the iron was hot

description: From Middle English stith (“steady, strong, cruel”), from Old English stīþ (“hard, cruel”), from Proto-West Germanic *stinþ, from Proto-Germanic *stinþaz. Compare also Old Frisian stīth, Middle Low German stīde, Middle Dutch stīde, Old Norse stinnr, Danish stind, Swedish stinn.

adjectives.description: stith (comparative more stith, superlative most stith)
